org.jdesktop.swingx.table
Class PropertyColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.swingx.table.AbstractColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
      org.jdesktop.swingx.table.PropertyColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
Type Parameters:
_RowType - The type of each row of the table.
_ValueType - The type of the value of this column's data.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
public class PropertyColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
extends AbstractColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>

Property-based implementation of AbstractColumn. This class lets you specify property names for your classes.

Constructor Detail

PropertyColumn

public PropertyColumn(java.lang.String pPropertyName,
                      java.lang.String pColumnName,
                      java.lang.Class pRowClass,
                      java.lang.Class pValueClass,
                      int pPrefWidth)
Create a PropertyColumn from a property name, column name, row and column classes, and column width. The render and editor default to null, and updateRow, updateSubsequentRows, and updateTable all default to false.

This generates an editable column if a setter exists for this property, and a non-editable property if the setter doesn't exist. For more complex behavior, override isEditable(_RowType)

Parameters:
pPropertyName - The name of the property of instances of the specified row class
pColumnName - The name of the column
pRowClass - The class of the table row instances
pValueClass - The class of the values of this column
pPrefWidth - the preferred width of this column
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if pRowClass doesn't have a getter for this property name.

PropertyColumn

public PropertyColumn(java.lang.String pPropertyName,
                      java.lang.String pColumnName,
                      java.lang.Class pRowClass,
                      java.lang.Class pValueClass,
                      int pPrefWidth,
                      javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer pRenderer,
                      javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor pEditor)
Create a PropertyColumn from a property name, column name, row and column classes, column width, Renderer, and Editor. updateRow, updateSubsequentRows, and updateTable all default to false.

This generates an editable column if a setter exists for this property, and a non-editable property if the setter doesn't exist. For more complex behavior, override isEditable(_RowType)

Parameters:
pPropertyName - The name of the property of instances of the specified row class
pColumnName - The name of the column
pRowClass - The class of the table row instances
pValueClass - The class of the values of this column
pPrefWidth - the preferred width of this column
pRenderer - The renderer for this column's data This may be null, which forces the default renderer.
pEditor - The editor for this column's data. This may be null, which forces the default editor.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if pRowClass doesn't have a getter for this property name.

PropertyColumn

public PropertyColumn(java.lang.String pPropertyName,
                      java.lang.String pColumnName,
                      java.lang.Class pRowClass,
                      java.lang.Class pValueClass,
                      int pPrefWidth,
                      javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer pRenderer,
                      javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor pEditor,
                      boolean updateRow,
                      boolean updateSubsequentRows,
                      boolean updateTable)
Create a PropertyColumn from a property name, column name, row and column classes, column width, Renderer, and Editor, and values for updateRow, updateSubsequentRows, and updateTable.

This generates an editable column if a setter exists for this property, and a non-editable property if the setter doesn't exist. For more complex behavior, override isEditable(_RowType)

Parameters:
pPropertyName - The name of the property of instances of the specified row class
pColumnName - The name of the column
pRowClass - The class of the table row instances
pValueClass - The class of the values of this column
pPrefWidth - the preferred width of this column
pRenderer - The renderer for this column's data This may be null, which forces the default renderer.
pEditor - The editor for this column's data. This may be null, which forces the default editor.
updateRow - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the whole row, false otherwise.
updateSubsequentRows - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the subsequent rows,
updateTable - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the entire table, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if pRowClass doesn't have a getter for this property name.

PropertyColumn

public PropertyColumn(java.lang.String pPropertyName,
                      java.lang.String pColumnName,
                      java.lang.Class pRowClass,
                      java.lang.Class pValueClass,
                      int pPrefWidth,
                      boolean updateRow,
                      boolean updateSubsequentRows,
                      boolean updateTable)
Create a PropertyColumn from a property name, column name, row and column classes, column width, and values for updateRow, updateSubsequentRows, and updateTable. The renderer and editor default to null

This generates an editable column if a setter exists for this property, and a non-editable property if the setter doesn't exist. For more complex behavior, override isEditable(_RowType)

Parameters:
pPropertyName - The name of the property of instances of the specified row class
pColumnName - The name of the column
pRowClass - The class of the table row instances
pValueClass - The class of the values of this column
pPrefWidth - the preferred width of this column
updateRow - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the whole row, false otherwise.
updateSubsequentRows - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the subsequent rows,
updateTable - True if changes to a cell in this column should force an update of the entire table, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.AssertionError - if pRowClass doesn't have a getter for this property name.

getUpdateRow

public boolean getUpdateRow(_RowType pRow)
Description copied from class: AbstractColumn
Specifies if changes to the current cell will cause changes elsewhere in the same row. By default this returns false. If changes to this cell can force changes to other cells in the same row then this method should be overridden to return true.

Overrides:
getUpdateRow in class AbstractColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
Parameters:
pRow - The row that is changing.
Returns:
true if changes to this cell force changes to other cells in the same row, false otherwise.
See Also:
SeparatedTableModel.setValueAt(Object,int,int)

getUpdateTable

public boolean getUpdateTable(_RowType pRow)
Description copied from class: AbstractColumn
Specifies if changes to the current cell will cause changes elsewhere in the table, in other rows. By default this returns false. If changes to this cell can force changes to cells in other rows then this method should be overridden return true.

Overrides:
getUpdateTable in class AbstractColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
Parameters:
pRow - The row that is changing.
Returns:
true if changes to this cell force changes to other rows in the table, false otherwise.
See Also:
SeparatedTableModel.setValueAt(Object,int,int)

getUpdateSubsequentRows

public boolean getUpdateSubsequentRows(_RowType pRow)
Description copied from class: AbstractColumn
Specifies if changes to the current cell will cause changes elsewhere in the table, in subsequent rows, but not in preceeding rows. By default this returns false. If changes to this cell can force changes to cells in other rows below this one then this method should be overridden to return true.

Overrides:
getUpdateSubsequentRows in class AbstractColumn<_RowType,_ValueType>
Parameters:
pRow - The row that is changing.
Returns:
true if changes to this cell force changes to rows below this cell, false otherwise.
